results.title: Global insights 4
results.creator_credit: SKA TV, Tom McKendrick, Campbell Manderson and Ntennis Davi
results.brief_description:
Global Insights 4 is a compilation of short video works of a subversive political nature, sourced from videoactivists, cultural saboteurs and ‘serious’ documentary-makers from around the world.
Pieces featured include an alternative US response to the incidents of September 11 2001, made by Indymedia NYC soon after the event; scenes from the front line of the democracy struggle in Malaysia. A remarkable sequence of (unarmed) indigenous peasants in Mexico taking over an army base; a Korean perspective on the rise of the new global economic orthodoxy and the resistance to it; the ‘no borders’ movement in Europe and Australia against the deportation and detention of refugees.
Adverts peppered throughout the program are actually ‘subverts’ - biting satirical 30-second statements about consumerism, gender, sexuality and possibilities for reshaping the world. Producers of this form range from disaffected advertisers to teenagers with an ironic message about climate change.
The Global Insights videos have seen hundreds of free public screenings from Tamil Nadu to Antarctica - inspiring grass-roots people’s action and fostering an independent and accessible screen culture globally.
Global Insights is put together on a miniscule budget by volunteers. It is a collaboration between hundreds of independent media makers around the world.

results.title: Tales from two schools
results.brief_description: Work created by students from Tarnagulla and Marong primary schools with animator Paul Fletcher as part of the Artists in Schools Project sponsored by the Department of Education and Arts Victoria. Contains original artwork by the students (from lower primary levels) that has been animated by the artist, footage of the students and animations created by the older students. Storyline is minimal but includes a flying potato adventure, a monster circus and experimental animation.

results.title: First Touch
results.brief_description: Using archival films of the Apollo lunar missions in the late 1960s and early 70s, this 2 screen video installation contemplates humankind’s first touch of the moon. Often considered a giant leap in human development, the video concentrates on the delicate and hesitant movements of the astronauts and their spaceships as they overcome the limits of outer space. With both humour and melancholy, stunning images of the moon, the earth, and the astronauts and their spacecraft, are interwoven into a wondrous contemplation of this extraordinary achievement.

results.title: End Game
results.creator_credit: Michael Fairlie, Emma Crimmings and Rhys Graham
results.brief_description: Using the fragments, clock leaders and strips of films found at the beginning and end of hundreds of old 16mm films, this Public Imaging work explores the visual beauty of the film’s surface. Concealed among ACMI’s vast film collection, these pieces of film are a testament to the aging wonder of celluloid. The play of light and colour that can be found in the interweaving of these accidents and offcuts makes for a hypnotic experience.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Fairlie, Emma Crimmings and Rhys Graham

results.title: Ron's story
results.creator_credit: Davide Grassi, Boris Greguric, Aldo Ivancic and Ron Athey
results.brief_description: Ron’s Story is a video based on the work and obsessions of Los Angeles-based extreme performance artist Ron Athey. The video is comprised of footage filmed at various performances staged at the Kapelica Gallery and the Cultural Centre Cankarjev dom in Ljubljana between 1996 and 2001.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Davide Grassi, Boris Greguric, Aldo Ivancic and Ron Athey

results.title: Blue
results.creator_credit: Curtis Wehrfritz, Michael Pacek, Bruce McDonald and Don McKellar
results.brief_description: Canadian horror director David Cronenberg puts in an impressive performance as a bored carpert factory executive whose daily routine involves minor flirtations with his secretary and cronic masturbation in the privacy of his office. This explicit and ultimately melancholy tale of pornography and loneliness is intercut with a 1960s era stag loop called ‘The bellboy and the bored housewife’ and features the film’s star reminiscing about her experiences in the sex trade.
